author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
pwsh.exe today doesn't contain file version information and the icon is only associated with the shortcut file and not the exe

Fix is to use rcedit to embed:
- icon
- product version
- file version
- product name
- copyright

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2883
Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5166
Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5034

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It seems CoreFX use [System.Reflection.Metadata](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Reflection.Metadata/) to read FileVersionInfo. Perhaps we can use the API to write meta data too.
[CoreFX implementation](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/tree/master/src/System.Reflection.Metadata/src/System/Reflection/Metadata)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov I think we can move to that later particularly if we expose cmdlets for it

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Do you want to exclude Unix from the PR?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov using the `file` command, the executable is a native executable whereas the .dll assemblies are PE32+ format which supports the embedded resources.  I don't think we can support this for non-Windows executables.

comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Thanks for clarify. I see Unix haven't a standard for this.
